lines.text: Kids today are amazing. I played winter ball down in Venezuela, they had kids half his age, every one of them speaking Spanish. That's a hard language.
They speak Spanish in Venezuela.
I know! That's my point!
If Joe can paint a house in three hours and Sam can paint the same house in five hours, how long will it take to paint it together?
Now wait a minute, you never said this was a word problem.
You're a frickin' primadonna, McGreavy. You don't deserve to wear that uniform.
You know, you're right, Mac. I'm a disgrace to the Twins. I think you should trade me.
As soon as we find someone dumb enough to take you, that's EXACTLY what we're gonna do.
No we're not. We're not trading you.
So what are you going to do, bench me?
Nope, play you. When it's your turn to pitch, you pitch. Nothing changes.
You know, I don't think that's such a good idea. I have a feeling my concentration's not going to be that good out there. I might tend to forget some of those scouting reports.
Well, that's up to you, you're the free agent. Hey Mac, what's the going rate for an absent-minded pitcher who can't get anybody out?
Hey 'Blackout,' I didn't get you for your curve ball. I don't like your curve ball. As a matter of fact, I hate your curve. You know why? Because the damn thing don't curve!
[repeated line]
Bite me.
[after the Twins lose their wild card playoff]
"wait 'til next year."
That's it right there. 'Cause next year, we're gonna win it all, baby.
Give me some of that.
[they slap hands, and the team cheers]
The Dodgers played in Brooklyn?
You should start Webman. He always beats the Rangers.
He always beats everybody. That's why he's 3-7.
Who would've thought they'd throw you a changeup with a three-two count and the bases loaded?
I bet you did, didn't you. You did! Ya knew it!
Isn't that wonderful? Your Grandfather gave you the twins!
I would rather have my Grandfather.
You what you should do? You should start Webman!
I had a feeling you were going to say that.

[Last Lines]
Excuse me Mr. Heywood! But um, they're still here.
Who?
Everybody!
I can't believe you lost to the Tigers, they stink!
Here's an easy one. Who was the first black player to play in the major leagues?
You want me to say Jackie Robinson, but I won't. Fleet Walker for Toledo. I believe the year was 1884.

[at school]
If I owned the Twins, I wouldn't even show up here. I'd just hire a bunch of scientists to do my homework. I mean, if you're rich you don't have to be smart. That's the whole beauty of this country.
It's a scientific fact that a pig becomes a hog at 180 pounds.
What's that make your wife?
Fat.

[after Billy apologizes to the team]
On behalf of the entire Apache Nation, we accept this olive branch of peace.

[team laughs]
Thanks, I think.
Man! When my Grandfather died, all I got was a sweater.

[after Scales was called out at first base during a home game against the Rangers]
What?
Come on, blue! He didn't touch me, blue! That's brutal, my momma could make that call blue, come on!

[to the first-base umpire, after the first-base coach gets Scales out of the way]
He missed the tag! He missed the tag!
and what are you, Bob Uecker?
That was a lousy call, you were out of position.
I saqw what I saw, so go sit down.
No, I'm not gonna sit down, because you're a big dork.
Oh yeah? Well, you're a little squirt with a big mouth, so why don't you get outta my face before I get mad?
Come on, get mad! Pop a vein, you ugly, big
[prolonged air horn sound, while Palmeiro's eyes get big]
... blind, seeing-eye dog.
You're outta here, Heywood!

[while kicking dirt on the umpire]
Yeah, that's right. Throw me out you big, fat
[prolonged air horn]
... and you're blind as a bat!
Get outta here!
Fine! Ever heard of Certs?
